spi.h File Reference

Callback function will be used to notify when the activity is finished.

int HAL_ReadSpi (HAL_SpiDescriptor_t *descriptor, uint8_t *buffer, uint16_t length)
 Writes a number of bytes to the SPI.
Callback function will be used to notify when the activity is finished.
The read data is placed to the buffer.

Detailed Description

The header file describes the USART SPI mode (for avr) and SPI1 bus (for arm).

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support email: avr@atmel.com

Definition in file spi.h.

Function Documentation

int HAL_OpenSpi ( HAL_SpiDescriptor_t *  descriptor  ) 

Opens USART in MSPI mode(for avr) or opens SPI1(for arm).

Parameters:
[in] descriptor - pointer to spi descriptor
Returns:
-1 - there are no free resources.
0 - SPI channel is ready.

int HAL_CloseSpi ( HAL_SpiDescriptor_t *  descriptor  ) 

Releases the channel and pins.

Parameters:
[in] descriptor - pointer to spi descriptor
Returns:
-1 - channel was not opened.
0 - success.

int HAL_WriteSpi ( HAL_SpiDescriptor_t *  descriptor,
uint8_t *  buffer,
uint16_t  length 
)

Writes a number of bytes to the SPI.
Callback function will be used to notify when the activity is finished.
.

Parameters:
[in] descriptor - pointer to HAL_SpiDescriptor_t structure
[in] buffer - pointer to the application data buffer
[in] length - number of bytes to transfer
Returns:
-1 - spi module was not opened, or there is unsent data, or the pointer to data or the length are NULL;
0 - success;
Number of written bytes - success (synchronous mode).

int HAL_ReadSpi ( HAL_SpiDescriptor_t *  descriptor,
uint8_t *  buffer,
uint16_t  length 
)

Writes a number of bytes to the SPI.
Callback function will be used to notify when the activity is finished.
The read data is placed to the buffer.

Parameters:
[in] descriptor - pointer to HAL_SpiDescriptor_t structure
[in] buffer - pointer to the application data buffer
[in] length - number of bytes to transfer
Returns:
-1 - spi module was not opened, or there is unsent data, or the pointer to data or the length are NULL;
0 - success;
Number of written bytes - success (synchronous mode).
